results.title: Teeth of the wind
results.creator_credit: Michael Hankinson, James Carr and World Wide
results.brief_description: An account of the locust problem and of the progress of modern organisation and international co-operation to combat the insect. Includes close-up shots of the locust at various stages of growth from egg to maturity.

results.title: Teddy bears at play [1939]
results.creator_credit: Winifred Lade, Mel F. Nichols and Australian National Travel Association
results.brief_description: An intimate study of the koala. This quaint and friendly creature with its soft round furry body is the most popular of Australia’s unique animals. Photographed by Mel. F. Nichols, edited by Winifred Lade.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Winifred Lade, Mel F. Nichols and Australian National Travel Association

results.title: The Technology machine
results.creator_credit: Sue Johnston and Educational Media Centre, RMIT
results.brief_description: An exploration of three attitudes to science and technology since 1900; the positive celebration of technology as the solution to mankind’s problems; the attitude that current technology trends are destroying the environment; and the ecologically conscious attitude towards technology and its uses. Narrated by Brian Leech.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Johnston and Educational Media Centre, RMIT
results.description: An exploration of three attitudes to science and technology since 1900; the positive celebration of technology as the solution to mankind’s problems; the attitude that current technology trends are destroying the environment; and the ecologically conscious attitude towards technology and its uses. results.title: Technology for the 1972 Olympic Games
results.brief_description: To carry out such a world event as the 1972 Olympic Games in Munich, a wide range of the most modern technical devices were necessary. The film highlights some of the technical achievements of the Games, in which Siemens Industries played an important technical role.
results.description: To carry out such a world event as the 1972 Olympic Games in Munich, a wide range of the most modern technical devices were necessary. The film highlights some of the technical achievements of the Games, in which Siemens Industries played an important technical role.

results.title: Teaching young children
results.creator_credit: Jane Massy, Dorothy Grayson and Realist Films
results.brief_description: This film deals with infant teaching as a vocation. It is designed for girls between the ages of 16 and 18 years; two girls are introduced, and their two-year course of study at an Infant Teaching Training College in Britain is followed, showing how, both in the college, and in teaching practice, their understanding of children aids them in teaching and at the same time advances and expands their own general education and social consciousness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Massy, Dorothy Grayson and Realist Films
results.description: This film deals with infant teaching as a vocation. results.title: The Teaching triad (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jerry Maybrook, Lane Wipff, Susan Rafin, AIMS Instructional Media and Dubnoff Center
results.brief_description: Focuses on the direct involvement of the educational therapist with the family of the handicapped child as well as the child himself. Defines the teacher parent child component as the teaching triad and demonstrates ways teachers and parents together can help to bring the child to his optimal level of development.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Maybrook, Lane Wipff, Susan Rafin, AIMS Instructional Media and Dubnoff Center

results.title: Teaching the way they learn: remediation of learning disabilities (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Learning Series”.
Dr. Sam Rabinovitch explains some of the methods used in teaching children with learning disabilities due to poor listening ability or poor bodily coordination. Points out how important it is that the child learns and understands what is being taught

results.title: Teaching teenagers about alcohol
results.brief_description: Shows to teachers the best methods of teaching teenagers about alcohol. Uses a summer seminar for teachers as a setting to describe one teacher’s highly successful approach to the problem.
